abstract.p: Martin Agency takes top honors, winning Best of Show, at annual Obie Awards for creative excellence sponsored by Outdoor Advertising Association of America; Chicago office of DDB Worldwide wins $100,000 grand prize for most creeative radio commercial at annual Radio Mercury Awards presentation, administered by Radio Creative Fund (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: Honors for advertising in two media have been presented by two organizations.
The Martin Agency in Richmond, Va., took top honors, winning Best of Show, at the 58th annual Obie Awards for creative excellence sponsored by the Outdoor Advertising Association of America.
Honors for advertising in two media have been presented by two organizations.
The Martin Agency in Richmond, Va., took top honors, winning Best of Show, at the 58th annual Obie Awards for creative excellence sponsored by the Outdoor Advertising Association of America.

Martin, part of the Lowe Group unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies, won the top Obie -- and $50,000 -- for outdoor work for CareerBuilder.com. The work also won an Obie in the consumer goods and services category.
The Ford Motor Company in Dearborn, Mich., was inducted into the association's Hall of Fame.

And at the ninth annual Radio Mercury Awards presentation, administered by the Radio Creative Fund, the Chicago office of DDB Worldwide, part of the Omnicom Group, won the $100,000 grand prize for the most creative radio commercial, for a spot for Bud Light, which is sold by the Anheuser-Busch Companies.

In the category honors, Casanova Pendrill Publicidad in Irvine, Calif., part of Interpublic, was awarded the $5,000 prize for Hispanic commercials, for work for Coors Brewing. Big Bang Idea Engineering in Delmar, Calif., won the best public service announcement trophy for work for the San Diego Blood Bank.
